729042f-b.title: Richmond: Jewett Avenue - Victory Boulevard
729042f-b.text:
Jewett Avenue, east side, about 300 yards north of Victory Boulevard, showing the remains of iron mlnes, at one time operated by the Richmond Iron Mining Company(Beers's 1874
map).
P.L.5perr  Viewsl23: April 28, 1927
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: 1924
729042f-b.folder: Jewett Avenue & Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY

729849f-a.title: Richmond: Victory Boulevard - Jewett Avenue
729849f-a.text:
Victory Boulevard, adjoining the N.E. corner of Jewett Avenue. The maps from 1874 to 1907 show the house to have belonged to W. Kirk. It was owned by Jos. M. Hoffmann in 1917.
April 25, 1929
P. L. Sperr
729849f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Jewett Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729886f-b.title: Richmond: Watchogue Road - Victory Boulevard
729886f-b.text:
(1)
Watchogue Road, west side, north of Victory Boulevard, showing the Blake House, a colonial structure. It was, at one time, inhabited by Daniel Blake, once police captain, who was a grandson of William W. Blake, of Revolutionary times.
1924.
P. 1  L. Sperr.
(2)
A distant view of the rear of the house, at a later date.
September 26, 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
729886f-b.folder: Watchogue Road & Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY
